## Background

During my bachelor's studies in [Business Psychology](https://www.hs-harz.de/en/study/faculty-of-business-studies/business-psychology-bsc),
I primarily focused on the user perspective, applying methods from market research and consumer psychology to address
specific content-related questions.
I deepened this perspective through internships and research assistant positions at market research institutes such
as [Ipsos GmbH](https://www.ipsos.com/en) and [Produkt+Markt GmbH](https://www.produktundmarkt.de/en/).

At the same time, I realized that I lacked knowledge in programming and modeling. Skills which are essential for
developing flexible models that could effectively address both substantive research questions and the specific
characteristics of data.
This realization motivated me to pursue a master's degree in [Cognitive Science](https://www.uni-osnabrueck.de/en/prospective-students/studiengaenge-a-z/cognitive-science-master-of-science/),
with a focus on artificial intelligence and cognitive psychology.
During this program, I gained experience in formal modeling, Bayesian methods and their implementation in R and Python, whereby
I was particularly impressed by the flexibility and expressiveness of the Bayesian framework.

Driven by a desire to deepen my expertise in formal modeling, Bayesian statistics, method development, and the
computational implementation of statistical methods, I remained in academia.
I worked first as a research scientist in [Psychological Methods](https://www.uni-marburg.de/de/fb04/team-heck)
at Philipps-University Marburg, and later in [Computational Statistics](https://compstat.statistik.tu-dortmund.de/)
at TU Dortmund University.

After several years in academia, my interests evolved toward applying my skills in areas with direct societal impact.
This led me to my current role as a research scientist at [Climate Resource](https://www.climate-resource.com/), where
I work at the intersection of climate science research, methodological development, and research software engineering.
In my current projects I focus among others on the development of new methodologies that integrate satellite-derived
information in the production of greenhouse gas forcing for Earth System Models.

Information about my current contributions can be found on [Publications & Talks](pubs.qmd) page as well as on my
[project website](https://florence-bockting.github.io/prior_elicitation/).
